Nanobody therapy rescues behavioural deficits of NMDA receptor hypofunction

A bivalent biparatopic nanobody penetrates the brain, binds to and potentiates the activity of homodimeric metabotropic glutamate receptor 2, correcting cognitive deficits in two preclinical mouse models with endophenotypes resulting from NMDA receptor hypofunction.

  • Mathieu Oosterlaken
  • Angelina Rogliardo
  • Philippe Rondard
ArticleOpen Access23 Jul 2025

elements.title: Three-step biosynthesis of salicylic acid from benzoyl-CoA in plants (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Three-step biosynthesis of salicylic acid from benzoyl-CoA in plants

The salicylic acid (SA) biosynthesis pathway—involving ligation of benzoyl coenzyme A and benzyl alcohol to give benzyl benzoate; hydroxylation of benzyl benzoate to give benzyl salicylate; and cleavage of benzyl salicylate to give SA—is highly conserved in plants.

  • Yanan Liu
  • Lu Xu
  • Yuelin Zhang
Article23 Jul 2025

  • Glennis A. Logsdon
  • Peter Ebert
  • Tobias Marschall
ArticleOpen Access23 Jul 2025

elements.contents:
NNMT inhibition in cancer-associated fibroblasts restores antitumour immunity

An NNMT inhibitor reduces tumour burden and metastasis in multiple mouse cancer models and restores immune checkpoint blockade efficacy by decreasing cancer-associated-fibroblast-mediated recruitment of myeloid-derived suppressor cells and reinvigorating CD8+ T cell activation.

  • Janna Heide
  • Agnes J. Bilecz
  • Ernst Lengyel
Article23 Jul 2025

  • Lilach Aizenbud
  • Aaron M. Ring

A plate-based assay called CRAFTseq has been developed that uses ‘multi-omic’ single-cell RNA sequencing and direct genotyping of CRISPR edits to test the functional effects of genetic variants on cell state and function.

  • Yuriy Baglaenko
  • Zepeng Mu
  • Soumya Raychaudhuri

  • Christian Foth
  • Rainer R. Schoch

A method combining scanning transmission electron microscopy with high-resolution electron energy-loss spectroscopy enables the observation of magnons and their dispersion, and provides a way to examine magnetic inhomogeneities with nanometre spatial resolution.

  • Demie Kepaptsoglou
  • José Ángel Castellanos-Reyes
  • Quentin M. Ramasse

  • Winston W. Liu
  • Naama Reicher
  • Diego V. Bohórquez
ArticleOpen Access23 Jul 2025

  • Thea Sommerschield
  • Shakir Mohamed

  • Jason R. Climer
  • Heydar Davoudi
  • Daniel A. Dombeck
Article23 Jul 2025

  • Yukang Wang
  • Shuyan Song
  • Ronghui Pan
ArticleOpen Access23 Jul 2025

  • Ziliang Kang
  • Johanna A. Gomez
  • Giovanni Traverso

  • S. R. Erlewein
  • S. Ulmer
